pull.title: doc: clarify that the "-j N" goes after the "--build build" part
pull.body: I was surprised that something like `cmake -j 4 --build build` doesn't work, so this might help others to not make the same mistake.

Concept ACK. It follows CMake [docs](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/manual/cmake.1.html#build-a-project).

Why not apply such a change across all the docs?

See the output of `git grep -i 'Use "-j N"'` for relevant instances.

Concept ACK 

> See the output of git grep -i 'Use "-j N"' for relevant instances.

Agreed with this. I also couldn't find any other patterns that should be updated here.

verification.payload:
tree 13670f26c0d4017e77d1a6a1296530ec8d5b8f6c
parent 23a00fcf571f6aeccc34d18061319ee600847834

committer Salvatore Ingala <6681844+bigspider@users.noreply.github.com> 1751364031 +0800

doc: clarify that the "-j N" goes after the "--build build" part

Also, capitalized the comments in build-unix.md for uniformity
with the docs on other targets.

events.message:
doc: clarify that the "-j N" goes after the "--build build" part

Also, capitalized the comments in build-unix.md for uniformity
with the docs on other targets.

events.body:
Done, and rebased.

I also noticed that the analogous comments were capitalized in all other `build-*.md` files, so I capitalized them in `build-unix.md` as well.

This may be unrelated, but cmake also respects some [environment variables](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/manual/cmake-env-variables.7.html).
So instead of passing `-j` to each command, you could just set `CMAKE_BUILD_PARALLEL_LEVEL` in bashrc or whatever your favorite shell uses. In fish, I use the following:

```fish
function cmake
  set -x CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LAUNCHER (which ccache)
  set -x CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LAUNCHER (which ccache)
  set -x CMAKE_BUILD_PARALLEL_LEVEL (nproc)
  set -x CMAKE_COLOR_DIAGNOSTICS 1
  set -x CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS 1
  set -x CMAKE_GENERATOR Ninja
  set -x CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX $HOME/.local
  set -x CMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM 3.5
  command cmake $argv
end
```

ACK 0e9f409db3b7b08aef75ce39765b018b69cc8e9d

Makes sense to clarify, have tripped over this as well in the past.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,9 +47,9 @@ This means you cannot use a directory that is located directly on the host Windo
 
 Build using:
 
-    gmake -C depends HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32  # Use "-j N" for N parallel jobs.
+    gmake -C depends HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32  # Append "-j N" for N parallel jobs.
comments.body: review note: `gmake` seems fine with placing `-j` earlier, so technically this change isn't necessary, but it's probably better to be consistent anyway.

comments.diff_hunk:

 Build using:
 
-    gmake -C depends HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32  # Use "-j N" for N parallel jobs.
+    gmake -C depends HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32  # Append "-j N" for N parallel jobs.
comments.body: Good point. Same for `ctest`, I think.

@@ -9,8 +9,8 @@ To Build
 
 ```bash
 cmake -B build
-cmake --build build    # use "-j N" for N parallel jobs
-cmake --install build  # optional
+cmake --build build    # Append "-j N" for N parallel jobs
+cmake --install build  # Optional
